explanation:
Agent A is correct. There exists a plausible indirect recursive call chain: ahc_echo calls MHD_queue_response; MHD_queue_response calls MHD_connection_handle_idle when connection->in_idle is false; MHD_connection_handle_idle calls call_connection_handler, which dispatches the user handler (ahc_echo) again. That yields ahc_echo -> MHD_queue_response -> MHD_connection_handle_idle -> call_connection_handler -> ahc_echo, i.e. indirect recursion.

Whether this path is taken depends on runtime flags (connection->in_idle versus connection->in_access_handler and threading model), but it is reachable in the implementation: MHD_queue_response unconditionally invokes MHD_connection_handle_idle when !connection->in_idle, and call_connection_handler is the library mechanism that invokes the user handler. Therefore the code permits an indirect re-entrant invocation of ahc_echo and thus violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 (functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly).
